Insulin out-of-pocket costs are now capped at $35 a month for Americans on Medicare.

Every Republican voted against this life-changing policy.

Democrats are making government work for the people.

For years, giant corporations have gotten away with paying little to nothing in federal taxes. Not anymore. My 15% corporate minimum tax will ensure companies pay a fairer share in taxes when they report billions in profits to their shareholders. It's now the law.
Members of Congress should not own or trade individual stocks. And neither should their spouses.
Wishing everyone in Massachusetts, across the country, and around the world a safe and happy New Year! I'm deeply grateful for the opportunity to keep fighting righteous fights alongside you.

Corporate profits reached record highs this year as giant corporations used inflation as cover to jack up prices for consumers and expand their profit margins. We need to promote competition and fight back against corporate price gouging.

Big wins in Congress this year.
▪️ Capping insulin costs for seniors to $35.
▪️ Securing $$ for our infrastructure systems.
▪️ Making big, bold investments for science research.
These are things that will be felt in our communities & make a big difference. https://t.co/bGCMVu9Aiz

Public defenders. Consumer advocates. Civil rights lawyers. Federal judges appointed by President Biden & confirmed by Senate Democrats not only have diverse personal backgrounds, but also diverse professional experiences. This work continues next year. https://t.co/akdKmBOhoK

After the extremist Supreme Court overturned Roe V. Wade, my friend @SenTinaSmith and I wrote a @nytopinion piece on that dark moment and how to hold onto hope. The danger is still real, and we must meet it with the urgency it deserves. https://t.co/uJX5MhK9wA

This year, Congress took steps to help address gun violence in America, but we still have a lot of work to do to pass stronger gun violence prevention laws. I reintroduced legislation to confront this crisis head-on and take big steps to make our communities safe.

Thanks to federal grant money, local school buses in western Massachusetts will soon be electric-powered! Electric buses were part of my Build Green legislation and will now be funded in part by finally taxing the profits of billionaire corporations. https://t.co/vLQNNxKDDc

@USDOT should use its antitrust tools to protect fliers, starting w blocking the @JetBlue-@SpiritAirlines merger.

Fed Chair Powell’s extreme interest rate hikes risk pushing our economy into a recession that costs millions of Americans their jobs. The Fed needs to remember it has a dual mandate: fight inflation and protect jobs.

This is what government that works for the people really looks like. No wonder Republicans in Congress oppose @CFPB holding @WellsFargo accountable.
https://t.co/6eFLwlFcjn

Congress passed the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act this week—legislation to expand protections for pregnant workers and ensure people don't lose their jobs simply because they're expecting a child. This action is great news for workers and long-overdue.

Ever lost track of hard-earned retirement savings when moving between jobs?
 
Congress passed my bill that creates a ‘lost and found’ database to make it easier for Americans to keep track of retirement savings, and get every dollar in benefits they've earned.

Massachusetts lawmakers and I secured $225 million in federal funding to support 160 community projects across the Commonwealth. These resources bolster local efforts to deliver health services and child care, promote clean energy and affordable housing, and expand opportunity.

President @ZelenskyyUa gave a powerful speech to Congress reminding us why we must continue to stand with the people of Ukraine in their pursuit of democracy and freedom. The U.S. and our allies should use every tool to bring an end to Russia’s illegal and brutal war.

Whether you’re heading to the symphony or on your daily commute to work, the federal infrastructure funding that @SenMarkey and I fought hard for will help make riding the T a better experience.

Improving the Symphony Station so that it's fully accessible will benefit everyone.

The most recent Pentagon civilian casualties report found far less than what independent reports show. The @DeptOfDefense pledged to do more to prevent civilian harm, but that can't start with inaccurate reporting. @RepSaraJacobs and I want answers. https://t.co/rcqEzqmCrb

Democrats have delivered on investments to fight climate change and lower drug costs — and paid for it with a 15% minimum tax on billionaire corporations.

It's possible to put government on the side of people. https://t.co/YPHmoELPtF

https://t.co/DFOQivlOvS

.@WellsFargo has repeatedly broken the law and ripped off its customers.

I've said it once, and I'll say it again: We need to break up Wells Fargo.

Americans wronged by @WellsFargo’s illegal actions will receive billions in refunds due to this historic step by @CFPB. This fine is much-needed accountability after Wells Fargo repeatedly abused consumers.

More regulators should follow @chopracfpb's lead to protect the public.

Further corporate consolidation in the defense industry raises both antitrust and national security concerns. I opposed @AerojetRdyne's previous failed merger deal and will continue to closely monitor antitrust enforcement against defense contractors.

Congress should not give billionaire corporations another tax break. We should provide relief for working families.

This weekend I visited Boston’s jewel of an art museum @mfaboston.

I stand with workers organizing for respect and dignity for MFA security guards. https://t.co/EKN7rrmF7e

I introduced my bill with @RepUnderwood to help the federal government address racial disparities in our health care system, address our maternal mortality and morbidity crisis, and ensure pregnant women and new moms aren’t left behind during public health emergencies.

Maternal mortality rates were already skyrocketing in states with restrictions on abortion. Then the Supreme Court struck down #RoeVWade, emboldening Republican politicians to enact even more dangerous laws that will cost lives and worsen this crisis.
https://t.co/tCuKOcRKC1

https://t.co/arX7sOi2pH
Private equity firms don't need another tax break.

The Pentagon's priorities should be reflected in its budget, but their wish lists have become a multi-billion dollar money grab. This needs to stop. My new bipartisan bill would reduce wasteful Pentagon spending and protect taxpayer dollars.

.@KraftHeinzCo has told its shareholders that it will keep prices high even as their costs decrease—and at the same time they're asking Congress for big corporate tax breaks. Nonsense. We need to help working families, not price-gouging corporations.

My dear friend @RepPressley fights from the heart and her love language is policy, just like mine. I have no doubt she would be an effective champion for women's rights if chosen to lead the Democratic Women’s Caucus. https://t.co/N9izd0WCZ6

Chair Powell has a dual mandate: to bring inflation down and keep unemployment low. But his rate hikes risk throwing millions out of work. He should remember that the people who'll lose their jobs aren't stockbrokers & CEOs, it's working people who need that paycheck every week.

10 years ago, 20 first graders and 6 adults lost their lives at Sandy Hook Elementary School. Congress took steps this year to help address gun violence, but we still have a lot of work to do to pass stronger gun violence prevention laws. We owe it to the lives lost & families.

Rogue nations, oligarchs and drug lords are using crypto to launder billions, evade sanctions and finance terrorism. My bipartisan bill puts common-sense rules in place to help close crypto money laundering loopholes and protect our national security.
https://t.co/n69LZfX8zX

Today President Biden signed the Respect for Marriage Act—historic legislation finally granting federal protections for LGBTQ+ and interracial couples. Democrats will keep fighting to protect Americans' right to marry who they love. Today and always, love wins.

Giant rail corporations have raked in profits by raising prices and squeezing their workers. Yet rail workers who keep the trains running aren't guaranteed paid sick leave. I'm here to say: We must hold the rail industry accountable & guarantee paid sick leave for these workers. https://t.co/ZgMBTG4eI3

https://t.co/3afsqDPqql

https://t.co/2aaLUKRJsm

I've long urged @TheJusticeDept to hold corporate executives personally accountable when their companies break the law.
 
Crypto executives who break the law are just like any other crooks. If Sam Bankman-Fried committed fraud, then federal prosecutors should send him to prison.

.@TysonFoods has gouged consumers with inflated prices for beef and chicken while rewarding investors with stock buybacks. But that's not all: Tyson's lobbying Congress for a big tax break. It's a nonstarter. Democrats stand with working families.

I've fought to keep the Green Line Extension project alive since day one of my time in the Senate. Today I'm thrilled to see this long overdue project completed. This Green Line extension will increase ridership by 50,000 trips a day & promote cleaner air & economic opportunity. https://t.co/WZP32vmRZt

Democrats are fighting to help families make ends meet and keep children out of poverty by renewing the expanded Child Tax Credit. Republicans want to give out tax breaks for giant corporations. We need to put families first.

Ever since I was elected to the Senate, I have fought for investments to clean our air and water. Yesterday I was in Fall River celebrating a significant federal investment to replace lead pipes & electrify our school buses. These are big, critical investments for Massachusetts! https://t.co/8Q0bgJhIKn

From the Inflation Reduction Act to promoting market competition to student debt cancellation—Democrats are fighting and delivering big for working people. Check out my conversation with @FeliciaWongRI and @mtomasky!

Corporate monopolies have had free rein to hike prices and harm workers, but now the Biden admin is committed to promoting competition.

I urged @linakhanFTC to scrutinize @Microsoft's proposed merger with @Activision & welcome this FTC action to block it. https://t.co/hX8PYQq6VB

Americans deserve answers.

Solidarity with workers internationally not only strengthens labor rights abroad, but also supports American workers.

Kelly Fay Rodríguez, raised in a union family from Worcester, Massachusetts, will be a strong advocate to elevate labor in trade and empower workers worldwide.

Since #RoeVWade was overturned, I've been raising the alarm that personal data collected by companies may put women at serious risk. We need more rules in place to prohibit third parties from exploiting Americans’ data.
https://t.co/mldEhB4CI8

For generations, the U.S. government has failed to fulfill its commitments to Tribal Nations & Native communities, chronically underfunding federal programs. @RepDerekKilmer & I have a new bill to make historic progress on finally honoring those promises.
https://t.co/RDKnZt5KWj

Americans are facing elevated prices at the grocery store. One of the reasons? Giant corporations have been using inflation as cover to abuse their market power and jack up prices for consumers. We need to crack down on corporate price gouging.

One easy way to ensure that Members of Congress do not abuse their office to benefit financially is to ban Members and their spouses from owning stocks.
 
Congress should pass legislation to make it happen. I’ve got a bipartisan bill to do exactly that.
With Democrats in the Senate majority, we will do everything we can to fight back against House Republican’s efforts to pass a national abortion ban.
No one should have to worry about being denied reasonable accommodations at work when they’re expecting a child — much less lose their job. Congress needs to pass the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act.

I agree with @POTUS: under no circumstances would I support proposals that cut Social Security or Medicare.

@GOPLeader should be willing to make the same commitment and take it off the table.
Happy Friday! 263k jobs were added in November and over 10.5 million jobs have been created under President Biden.
Let's be clear: the President has the legal authority to cancel student debt.

Rail corporations have made money hand over fist, doubling profit margins and spending billions on stock buybacks. It’s shameful the vast majority of Republican Senators blocked essential rail workers from receiving guaranteed paid sick leave.

We need to double down on fighting corporate power and delivering for working families. That means blocking anti-competitive mergers, breaking up giant corporate monopolies, and taking on corporate price gouging to lower costs for families.

The federal government is responsible for providing for the health of Native Americans, but @IHSgov is the only major federal provider of health care that faces budget uncertainty. It's time for Congress to guarantee predictable funding and end this inequity. #AdvanceIndianHealth

Congratulations to my friend @RepKClark! She is an effective champion for working families in Massachusetts and across the nation. I can't wait to see the great work that she will do helping to lead @HouseDemocrats!
Rail companies rake in billions of dollars every year so don't tell me they can't afford to provide paid sick leave to rail workers.
Today, the Senate passed the Respect for Marriage Act! Democrats will keep fighting to protect Americans' right to marry who they love, even when this extremist Supreme Court threatens this right.

I've called out @Kroger and @Albertsons for price gouging consumers at the grocery store. If their deal to merge goes through, this could further increase concentration in the grocery chain industry, hurt workers, and increase prices. @FTC should oppose this deal.
Americans deserve the right to make their own decisions about their own bodies. Congress needs to make #RoeVWade the law of the land again.

Republican officials trying to block student debt relief reveals one of the clearest examples of differences between Democrats and Republicans. Democrats want to help people getting crushed by student debt. Republicans just want to help billionaires and giant corporations. https://t.co/XKKIVlQSMY

Supreme Court Justices should be bound by a basic code of ethics. We need to reform our judicial ethics system and I’ve got a bill for that.

Large corporations are using inflation as cover to jack up prices and expand their profit margins. We must promote market competition, enforce our antitrust laws, and crack down on corporate price gouging.

Extreme abortion bans are not only wildly unpopular, they're also threatening women's lives.

Thanksgiving is a day to celebrate the kindness and generosity of others and to count our many blessings. I want to wish everybody and their families a #HappyThanksgiving!

Americans are getting gouged with higher grocery prices this Thanksgiving as supermarkets pad their profits. We need to crack down on this corporate profiteering.

The “Big Five” book publishers control 90 percent of the market. This lack of competition increases prices for consumers and decreases earnings for authors—while enriching a privileged few.

Major antitrust win for the Biden admin’s competition policy. https://t.co/3TNRzzpsgX

Extending the student loan payment pause is the right move by the Biden administration. Baseless lawsuits from Republican officials are preventing millions of hard working Americans from receiving student debt cancellation, but Democrats are committed to delivering relief.

The President has the legal authority to cancel student debt.
 
President Trump did it. President Obama did it. And President Biden has been doing it.
 
But Republican officials are doing everything they can to block this relief. https://t.co/74uXGn7n72

Americans agree it’s time to make corporations finally pay a minimum tax on their billions in profit and call out their price gouging.

Now lobbyists want us to turn around and pass corporate tax breaks. Nonsense.

We fight for working families, not special interests.

The American people overwhelmingly support protecting the right to an abortion. But as states implement restrictions on abortion care, it is more important than ever that the @US_FDA consider immediate steps to expand access to medication abortion.

It’s time for Congress to provide a pathway to citizenship for Dreamers. And it's also long past time for DACA recipients to be able to work in Congress like their peers. I strongly support legislation to accomplish both these things, and I'll keep fighting for them.

As a lawyer, teacher & Senator, I’ve worked my entire career to help families that are squeezed by an economy & student loan system that saddled them with debt. I'll keep working with @usedgov & @TheJusticeDept to ensure borrowers can access relief these changes aim to deliver.

For many years, the treatment of people who borrowed money to go to school has been much harsher than for those who ran up other kinds of debts. Now, within the law, the Biden admin has begun to build meaningful change.

The Biden administration has taken an important step forward to reform a deeply broken bankruptcy system that has made it nearly impossible for Americans to deal with student debt, even when they’re in severe financial stress.

From major climate investments to more affordable health care, @SpeakerPelosi delivered for the people as one of the most effective leaders in Congress. Americans are better off thanks to her barrier-breaking leadership.

Democrats can beat Republican extremism by fighting for working people and making our democratic values clear.

Republicans fight hard for billionaires, billionaire corporations, and conspiracy theorists. Democrats must be willing to fight even harder for working families.

Medicare will be able to negotiate lower prescription drug prices. Insulin costs will be capped for seniors. And we're making investments to fight climate change.
 
Republicans voted no on all of this.

Now it's time for Republican politicians to get out of the way so Americans can finally receive this relief.

They want to slash Social Security and Medicare benefits from hard-working Americans.

Republicans and Democrats are fighting for very different things.

We need to make #RoeVWade the law of the land again. 

That's what Democrats are fighting for.

The #AmericanRescueAct is a historic piece of legislation for our country’s recovery from this pandemic and economic crisis. But I want to take a moment to mention some of the big wins we fought for to help families back home in Massachusetts:

Today we remember the family, friends, and neighbors we loved – and we search for a way to settle this loss in our hearts. We need each other more than ever, working together to build tomorrow, and the next day, and the next day, with opportunities for better days ahead.

On this one-year anniversary, I’m optimistic about the future. We have vaccines and a strong relief package on the way. The numbers are looking better. But our hearts still hurt from everything and everyone that this pandemic has stolen from us.

And our essential workers – including grocery store workers, farm workers, warehouse workers, meatpacking workers, restaurant workers, and delivery workers – have risked their health in the scariest conditions to keep us safe and fed. We’re in their debt.

Our doctors, nurses, hospital staff, public health experts and scientists have worked around the clock, one grueling day after another, to stop the virus. They’ve carried the weight of the world on their shoulders – our hopes and our heartbreak. They deserve our thanks every day.

When the WHO declared COVID-19 a global pandemic one year ago today, our country didn’t know what was around the corner. Over half a million lives lost. Tens of millions sick. Jobs gone and businesses shuttered. Unthinkable grief without hugs for comfort.
